Topic.Title: Yahoo to Layoff 1500 Employees

Message.Title: Yahoo’s Mayer Urged to Repurchase Stock With Alibaba Gain
Message.Msg: A buyback would give the signal that investors seek that Mayer has confidence in Yahoo’s growth prospects and in her ability to use innovative products to lure back users and advertisers who have defected to Google Inc. and Facebook Inc. A dividend, by contrast, may be seen as a tacit admission that management lacks fresh ideas to revive its business and must rely instead on regular cash outlays to hold on to investors. With a buyback, Yahoo’s stock can double to $32 within a year, said Brett Harriss, an analyst at Gabelli & Co. Yahoo has said it will return proceeds from the Alibaba transaction to investors, without specifying when or how. “They have historically bought back a lot of stock, and I think they’ll look at that as being the most efficient way to reduce the share count,” said Ryan Jacob, chief investment officer at Jacob Asset Management, who oversees a $120 million portfolio, including Yahoo shares. “It’s clearly trading at a valuation that’s below the sum of its parts.”

Topic.Title: Yahoo’s Mayer Urged to Repurchase Stock With Alibaba Gain

Message.Msg: With a buyback, Yahoo’s stock can double to $32 within a year, said Brett Harriss, an analyst at Gabelli & Co.

Topic.Title: Yahoo's New CFO to OK Stock Buyback

Message.Msg: It seems evident to me that neoalpha and gloom had much rather spend their time hiding under a can than reading corporate reports. YHOO has a BOD approved SEC notified stock repuirchase plan aurthorized in the amount of 5B, and I think some authorized buyback authority under one of the previous authorized plans. Read the last report and learn. It is under this authority that YHOO announced repurchase of 40M shares in conjunction with the last quarterly report. There is no need for CFO approval and the valet does not need to worry about approving the sale of Y-J. Speaking of Y-J, I would like to see YHOO do a secondary offering in Japan and unload about 1/3 of their holdings, especially while Y-J is booming higher at this time.

Message.Title: Yahoo investors want buyback, not dividend
Message.Msg: Yahoo’s investors want the company to use the money from its recent Alibaba deal to buy back shares, rather than pay a dividend. According to a report in Bloomberg, investors and analysts support a buyback because it will show that Yahoo’s executives have confidence in the company’s prospects. A dividend could be seen as a way to appease investors without revitalizing the business. An analyst told Bloomberg that Yahoo’s stock could double to $32 if it moves forward with a buyback.

Message.Msg: Yes, the boards were better before then they are now. I too, have substantially cut on my useage to as they are not too hard to use and too slow.

Topic.Title: I think yahoo should just go bankrupt

Message.Msg: Gosh, they are going to have to try harder to lose money. Currently and for the last few years they have made over a billion each year in annual profit. That is the kind of garbage you can throw in my direction. Why (or more importantly how) do you think they should go bankrupt?

Topic.Title: Yahoo Finance portfolio pages

Message.Msg: Yep, that is what i have been saying for months now. No one at Yahooooooo listens.

Topic.Title: I think yahoo should just go bankrupt

Topic.Title: Yahoo investors want buyback, not dividend

Message.Msg: An analyst told Bloomberg that Yahoo’s stock could double to $32 if it moves forward with a buyback. There's no if about it. Yahoo will do a $3.6B buyback.
